intro: Macrotomia onosmoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain minute seeds. Macrotomia onosmoides is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
